result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Bradley J. Fowler appeared by video means. Defendant requested a furlough.  Judge wants to make a record.  Defendant has several cases, in jail on Arrest and commitment orders.  Defendant wants to attend a hearing in Milwaukee for his daughter.  Judge informs the defendant he is unable to grant a furlough because he has an active warrant out of Langlade County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 & 3.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Count 2 DRI.  Defendant wants to do straight jail time.  Arguments by State and Attny Joey Roeth.  Court orders 1 year jail with credit, good time, huber and can serve in Langlade County if actual incarceration.  $100 + costs and DNA surcharge.

Defendant Bradley J. Fowler in court with attorney Joey Lynn Roeth.  Defendant Bradley J. Fowler in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remarks by Atty. Roeth regarding potential resolution.  Discussion regarding correspondence from the jail and medical appointments.  Defense will file motion later if additional medical procedures are necessary.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Absolute Sobriety, No contact with "The Leaky Roof" saloon and Vee's Star Campsite, the Def. can attend medical appointment's IF he follows the jails rule for medical appt.'s release, the Court may consider possible furlough at a later date if Def. can't follow release rules of the jail.

Defendant Bradley J. Fowler in court with Attorney Joey Lynn Roeth.  Defendant Bradley J. Fowler in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ruling: 1) Def. can attend medical appointment's IF he follows the jails rule for medical appt.'s release. 2) The Court may consider possible furlough IF the Def. can't do #1. 
3) Court lowers the cash bond amount to $1500.00 w/same bond conditions.
hand given to Atty. Roeth for her client.
